basics.name: Nathaniel Morgan
basics.label: Computer Science and Engineering Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at MIT with expertise in computer science, DevOps, and NLP AI engineering. Focused on LLM research and innovative tech solutions.

work.name: SALIERI.AI
work.summary: Developed server-less SaaS deployment for structuring LLM output into parsable JSON.
highlights: Created webhook API with Node.js for inter-process communication with Python.
Developed containerized microservices with Kubernetes for scalability.
Implemented Context-Free Grammars for token generation constraints.
Built Kubernetes cluster with MySQL data store on Google Cloud Platform.

research.summary: Conducted research on LLM natural language embedded program generation.
highlights: Produced over 50 ground truth Python programs for synthetic data generation.
Created API calls for data collection from Google Data Commons.

projects.name: ARK (Automated Resource Knowledge Base)
projects.description: Simulated data retrieval and storage of human brain processes.
highlights: Configured Local LLM Inference with Llama CPP and Mistral 7b weights.
Built Vector DB for information storage and retrieval.

projects.name: Uplift.co
projects.description: Non-profit organization addressing teen mental health issues.
highlights: Organized first cohort and facilitated weekly meetings.
Developed branding, including website and digital wellness campaigns.

publications.name: THREAD: Thinking Deeper with Recursive Spawning

awards.title: SIPB Keyholder
awards.awarder: MIT Student Information and Processing Board
